title: No, blue fish aren't responsible for hundreds of deaths every year.
text: When spring turns to summer, do you have to be careful about fish dying in blue while you step into the water to cool off? The article was referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) Let's see if Plogel is responsible for more than 500 human deaths in the United States every summer. Facebook was published on January 11, 2021 in Facebook, Nancy Belusi, who was no longer the Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Buterman. On January 12, 2021, fish did not appear on the Britannica list for 10 of the world's most dangerous fish, although the Birana (correctly abandoned) ranked fourth. Meanwhile, it is one of the most popular sports fish in the United States, according to the United States. The fish and wildlife service. The range of fish extends from North America, from Canada to northern Mexico, and loves quiet streams, pools, lakes and small and medium-sized lakes. Their diet? Insects, insects larvae small crustaceans and worms. (No humans on the list) We have not been able to find any credible evidence that blue fish prey on people, let alone kill hundreds of them every year. But what should we be afraid of humans?
